com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.android.opengl

Class WOWZGLES.EglEnv

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.android.opengl.WOWZGLES.EglEnv
  • Enclosing class:
    WOWZGLES

    public static class WOWZGLES.EglEnv
extends java.lang.Object
    The class used by the GoCoder SDK to encapsulate OpenGL ES.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the default EGLDisplay and creates a new EGLContext that shares resources with the specified shared EGLContext.
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLContext eglContextShared, android.opengl.EGLSurface eglBaseSurface)
      Deprecated.  
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext, java.lang.Object nativeSurface)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the default EGLDisplay, creates a new EGLContext that shares resources with the specified shared EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext, java.lang.Object nativeSurface, boolean recordable)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the default EGLDisplay, creates a new EGLContext that shares resources with the specified shared EGLContext, supports the EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE extension, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay, android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGLDisplay and the EGLContext.
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay, android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext, android.opengl.EGLSurface eglSurface)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGLDisplay, EGLContext, and EGLSurface.
      EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay, android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext, java.lang.Object nativeSurface)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGLDisplay and EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with an EGLSurface.
      EglEnv(int eglVersion)
      Creates and initializes an instance with the specified EGL version and the default EGLDisplay, and create a new EGLContext that supports the EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE extension.
      EglEnv(int eglVersion, boolean recordable)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGL version and the default EGLDisplay, and creates a new EGLContext.
      EglEnv(int eglVersion, android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext, boolean recordable)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the default EGLDisplay and creates a new EGLContext that shares resources with the specified shared EGLContext.
      EglEnv(int eglVersion, android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay, android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext, android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext, java.lang.Object nativeSurface, boolean recordable)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified parameters.
      EglEnv(int eglVersion, android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay, java.lang.Object nativeSurface, boolean recordable)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGL version and the specified EGL display, creates a new EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.
      EglEnv(int eglVersion, java.lang.Object nativeSurface, boolean recordable)
      Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGL version and the default EGL display, creates a new EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.

      Unbinds this EglEnv instance from the current rendering thread.

      Releases the EGL resources associated with thie EglEnv instance.

      Releases any current EGLSurface for this EglEnv instance.

      Deprecated. 
      Use generateEglWindowSurface(java.lang.Object) instead.
      boolean setPresentationTime(long nanoseconds)
      Sets the presentation time for a rendered frame on this EglEnv instance's EGLSurface.
      boolean setSharedEglContext(android.opengl.EGLContext eglSharedContext)
      Establishes a new shared EGLContext; destroys the current EGLContext if there is one.
      void setTextureId(int textureId)
      Deprecated. 
      Do not use EglEnv to track texture IDs.
      boolean swapBuffers()
      Posts the contents of this EglEnv instance's EGLSurface to the native Android surface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(int eglVersion,
              android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay,
              android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext,
              android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext,
              java.lang.Object nativeSurface,
              boolean recordable)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        eglVersion - The EGL version to use, either 2 or 3.
        eglDisplay - The EGL display. If EGL14.EGL_NO_DISPLAY is specified, the value EGL14.EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY will be used.
        eglContext - The EGL context. If EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, an EGLContext will be created.
        sharedEglContext - Unless EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, the newly created context will share EGL resources with the specified context.
        nativeSurface - If this is not null and is an instance of Surface or SurfaceTexture, an EGLSurface will be created to wrap the native Android surface.
        recordable - Indicates that the newly created context should support the EGL EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE for use with android.media.MediaCodec.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext,
              java.lang.Object nativeSurface,
              boolean recordable)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the default EGLDisplay, creates a new EGLContext that shares resources with the specified shared EGLContext, supports the EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE extension, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.
        Parameters:
        sharedEglContext - Unless EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, the newly created context will share EGL resources with the specified context.
        nativeSurface - If this isn't null and is an instance of Surface or SurfaceTexture, an EGLSurface will be created to wrap the native Android surface.
        recordable - Indicates that the newly created context should support the EGL EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE for use with android.media.MediaCodec.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLContext sharedEglContext,
              java.lang.Object nativeSurface)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the default EGLDisplay, creates a new EGLContext that shares resources with the specified shared EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.
        Parameters:
        sharedEglContext - Unless EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, the newly created context will share EGL resources with the specified context.
        nativeSurface - If this isn't null and is an instance of Surface or SurfaceTexture, an EGLSurface will be created to wrap the native Android surface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(int eglVersion,
              android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay,
              java.lang.Object nativeSurface,
              boolean recordable)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGL version and the specified EGL display, creates a new EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with a newly created EGLSurface.
        Parameters:
        eglVersion - The EGL version to use, either 2 or 3.
        eglDisplay - The EGL display. If EGL14.EGL_NO_DISPLAY is specified, the value EGL14.EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY will be used.
        nativeSurface - If this isn't null and is an instance of Surface or SurfaceTexture, an EGLSurface will be created to wrap the native Android surface.
        recordable - Indicates that the newly created context should support the EGL EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE for use with android.media.MediaCodec.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay,
              android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext,
              android.opengl.EGLSurface eglSurface)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGLDisplay, EGLContext, and EGLSurface.
        Parameters:
        eglDisplay - The EGL display. If EGL14.EGL_NO_DISPLAY is specified, the value EGL14.EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY will be used.
        eglContext - The EGL context. If EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, an EGLContext will be created.
        eglSurface - The EGL surface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(android.opengl.EGLDisplay eglDisplay,
              android.opengl.EGLContext eglContext,
              java.lang.Object nativeSurface)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGLDisplay and EGLContext, and wraps the specified Android surface with an EGLSurface.
        Parameters:
        eglDisplay - The EGL display. If EGL14.EGL_NO_DISPLAY is specified, the value EGL14.EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY will be used.
        eglContext - The EGL context. If EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, an EGLContext will be created.
        nativeSurface - If this isn't null and is an instance of Surface or SurfaceTexture, an EGLSurface will be created to wrap the native Android surface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

        Parameters:

        eglContext - The EGL context. If EGL14.EGL_NO_CONTEXT is specified, an EGLContext will be created.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(int eglVersion,
              boolean recordable)
        Creates and initializes an instance using the specified EGL version and the default EGLDisplay, and creates a new EGLContext.
        Parameters:
        eglVersion - The EGL version to use, either 2 or 3.
        recordable - Indicates that the newly created context should support the EGL EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE for use with android.media.MediaCodec.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

      • EglEnv

        public EglEnv(int eglVersion)
        Creates and initializes an instance with the specified EGL version and the default EGLDisplay, and create a new EGLContext that supports the EGL_ANDROID_RECORDABLE extension.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an error occurs during the creation process.

        public boolean makeNothingCurrent()
        Unbinds this EglEnv instance from the current rendering thread.
        Returns:
        True if successful; false if an error occurred.
        See Also:
        eglMakeCurrent

      • copySurfaceContents

        public boolean copySurfaceContents(android.opengl.EGLSurface sourceSurface,
                                   int surfaceWidth,
                                   int surfaceHeight)
        Copies the content of the specified EGLSurface to this instance's EGLSurface. For this operation to be supported, the following conditions must be met:
        1. This EglEnv instance's EGLContext must have been created with EGL version 3.
        2. This EglEnv instance's EGLContext must have been created by specifying the same EGLContext on which the source EGLSurface was created as a shared context.
        3. An EGLSurface must have been created for this EglEnv instance.
        Parameters:
        sourceSurface - The source EGLSurface.
        surfaceWidth - The width of the source EGLSurface.
        surfaceHeight - The height of the source EGLSurface.
        Returns:
        True if successful; false if an error occurred.

      • setPresentationTime

        public boolean setPresentationTime(long nanoseconds)
        Sets the presentation time for a rendered frame on this EglEnv instance's EGLSurface.
        Parameters:
        nanoseconds - The frame's presentation time, in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        True if successful; false if an error occurred.
        See Also:
        ANDROID_presentation_time

      • swapBuffers

        public boolean swapBuffers()
        Posts the contents of this EglEnv instance's EGLSurface to the native Android surface. If the native surface is associated with an android.media.MediaCodec, the contents will be processed by the active encoder or decoder.
        Returns:
        True if successful; false if an error occurred.
        See Also:
        eglSwapBuffers

      • setSharedEglContext

        public boolean setSharedEglContext(android.opengl.EGLContext eglSharedContext)
        Establishes a new shared EGLContext; destroys the current EGLContext if there is one.
        Parameters:
        eglSharedContext - The shared EGLContext.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if an error occurred.

      • generateEglWindowSurface

        public android.opengl.EGLSurface generateEglWindowSurface(java.lang.Object nativeSurface)
        Generates a new EGLSurface that wraps the specified native Android surface; destroys the current EGLSurface if there is one.
        Parameters:
        nativeSurface - An instance of an Android Surface or SurfaceTexture.
        Returns:
        The newly created EGLSurface, or EGL14.EGL_NO_SURFACE if an error occurred.

      • releaseSurface

        public void releaseSurface()
        Releases any current EGLSurface for this EglEnv instance.
